body_html: I don't believe the image_resizer gets backed into the model, so you need to make sure that 1) you're training on the same size that you feed into --input_shapes, and that the dimensions you give to --input_shapes match that specified in TF_OD_API_INPUT_SIZE
body_text: I don't believe the image_resizer gets backed into the model, so you need to make sure that 1) you're training on the same size that you feed into --input_shapes, and that the dimensions you give to --input_shapes match that specified in TF_OD_API_INPUT_SIZE
body: I don't believe the image_resizer gets backed into the model, so you need to make sure that 1) you're training on the same size that you feed into --input_shapes, and that the dimensions you give to --input_shapes match that specified in [TF_OD_API_INPUT_SIZE](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/b390be62ad0514f4fd3347b9db3446c84e08a38e/tensorflow/contrib/lite/examples/android/app/src/main/java/org/tensorflow/demo/DetectorActivity.java#L52)
